attributes.action: Block George Osborne from cutting Free School Meals for Infants.
attributes.additional_details:
£14 billion of spending within early years education is subject to cuts and the Universal Infant Free School Meals programme (UIFSM), which is estimated to cost between £600m & £800m per year.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Free_school_meal
If Tax Evasion was targeted over cutting more and more from those in financial constraint.http://blogs.channel4.com/factcheck/factcheck-benefits-fraud-tax-evasion/20139 Information regarding tax evasion.
stats not including Amazon or Starbucks who pay no tax.
attributes.background: The goverment plans to cut Free School Meals for infants, leaving children hungry. Poverty and Austerity set upon us by our goverment, We cannot let this happen. This is the start of many more cuts expected as Mr Osborne has said cuts up to 40% spending cuts are needed. When will this stop?!!

rejection.details:
I'm sorry - we cannot accept duplicate petitions. We think this petition is similar to yours:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/107913

You might like to sign this petition instead. It is more likely to get more signatures that way.
